snippet: When the number of approved textbooks for Russia’s 14 million schoolchildren was slashed by more than half, one publisher with close ties to President Vladimir V. Putin profited handsomely.
abstract: Arkady R Rotenberg, newly appointed chairman of publisher Enlightenment, and member of Pres Vladimir V Putin's inner circle, benefits from purge of textbooks that Russian schoolchildren had relied on for years; purge is latest in a string of government maneuvers that have positioned Enlightenment, once sole provider of school textbooks under Soviet rule, to dominate the Russian textbook marketplace yet again (Series: Putin's Way).

byline.original: By JO BECKER and STEVEN LEE MYERS
byline.contributor: Masha Goncharova, Nikolay Khalip and Alexandra Odynova contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: When the number of approved textbooks for Russia’s 14 million schoolchildren was slashed by more than half, one publisher with close ties to President Vladimir V. Putin profited handsomely.

headline.main: Putin’s Friend Profits in Purge of Schoolbooks
